apiroute.title: URI of the WIFI controller.
apiroute.description: Should be in the format of: http://aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd or https://aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd

uuid.title: Client UUID token if needed
uuid.description: Should be a 32 digit hex string. Most Daikin devices do not need a UUID token. Read the documentation: https://github.com/cbrandlehner/homebridge-daikin-local#httpsregistered-client-support

system.title: Default Daikin device, Skyfi-model, or Faikin (ESP32-Faikin)?
system.description: Select 'Faikin' if using ESP32-Faikin chipset. Try with 'Default' first for standard Daikin WiFi modules before choosing other options. Consult the documentation for more information.

swingMode.title: Swing mode
swingMode.description: Apple Home allows to enable OSCILLATE. However most Daikin ACs support different swing modes. This setting allows to choose the swing-mode used if oscillation is enabled.

disableFan.title: Fan disabled
disableFan.description: Whether to have both AC and Fan or only AC

fanMode.title: Fan mode
fanMode.description: If in DRY-mode, switching on the FAN in Apple-Home will start the AC in dry mode. If in FAN-mode, it will only activate the FAN.

fanPowerMode.title: Fan power mode
fanPowerMode.description: Should Fan power only affect the fan or complete device.

fanName.title: FAN name
fanName.description: The name of the fan. Only applies if the FAN has not been disabled.

defaultMode.title: Default operation mode
defaultMode.description: When turning on the Daikin device in HomeBridge using a single-tap, the default operation mode will be applied. The Daikin-Auto-mode does not match Apple-Homekit - so it is advised to use either COOL- or HEAT-mode if possible.

enableHumiditySensor.title: Humidity sensor enabled
enableHumiditySensor.description: Enables humidity sensor if present in Daikin device.

enableEconoMode.title: Econo Mode switch enabled
enableEconoMode.description: Enables a switch in HomeKit to toggle the AC's Econo mode (energy-saving mode).

econoModeName.title: Econo Mode switch name (optional)
econoModeName.description: Custom name for the Econo Mode switch. Toggle the switch and check Homebridge logs to identify which one it is.

enablePowerfulMode.title: Powerful Mode switch enabled
enablePowerfulMode.description: Enables a switch in HomeKit to toggle the AC's Powerful mode (maximum cooling/heating).

powerfulModeName.title: Powerful Mode switch name (optional)
powerfulModeName.description: Custom name for the Powerful Mode switch. Toggle the switch and check Homebridge logs to identify which one it is.

enableNightQuietMode.title: Night Quiet Mode switch enabled
enableNightQuietMode.description: Enables a switch in HomeKit to toggle the AC's Night Quiet mode (silent operation for nighttime).

nightQuietModeName.title: Night Quiet Mode switch name (optional)
nightQuietModeName.description: Custom name for the Night Quiet switch. Toggle the switch and check Homebridge logs to identify which one it is.

enableACModes.title: AC Modes slider enabled
enableACModes.description: Enables a fan slider in HomeKit to switch between Dry and Fan-only modes. 0-20%=Off, 21-49%=Dry, 50-79%=Fan, 80-100%=Normal modes.

response.title: Response
response.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the device to start responding.  Default: 2000 (2 seconds).

deadline.title: Deadline
deadline.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the device to complete a response.  Default: 60000 (one minute).

retries.title: Retries
retries.description: The plugin can retry to reconnect in case of a connection problem. Default: 5.
